result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark S Scoville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation on counts 1&2 to run concurrent to each other

miscConds.notes:
Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Mark S Scoville, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson. Amended information filed reducung to misdemeanor, agreement reached.

Pre-trial conference at 12-01-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 12-17-2015 08:50 am.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Fredrickson  Defendant acknowledges receipt of the Information  The defense waived reading of the information and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT

Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Mark S Scoville, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson. Preliminary hearing waived, matter bound over  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:50 am.
Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Mark S Scoville, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Have not reached an agreement  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
allowing child visitation through a third party

Pre-trial conference at 08-25-2015 02:45 pm.
Status conference at 09-03-2015 03:10 pm.

Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Mark S Scoville, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Victim asking that the no contact be lifted and changed to no violent or disorderly contact - denied.  Third party contact allowed no more 3 times a week granted.,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 02:45 pm.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 03:10 pm.

The defendant shall have no contact with K.S.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
AMENDED - Defendant may have third party contact for child placement/visitation no more than three times a week.

Court Commission Sautebin appeared by telephone; No Court reporter present;  ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail.   Defendant advised of right to an attorney. State requests signature bond of $5000.00 with no contact with K.S.
